Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of anxiety regarding an upcoming hearing but has been managing these feelings through journaling.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient finds journaling helpful for processing worries and celebrating positive experiences, such as reconnecting with an old client and considering collaborations with local photographers. They are also working on managing anxiety through meditation and journaling, feeling more prepared for the hearing.
Current Functional Status: The patient has engaged in solo activities, such as attending an art class, which has helped them rediscover their love for painting and reconnect with themselves.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice positive affirmations and focus on their strengths, which include resilience and creativity.
Next Steps: The patient plans to continue journaling and remind themselves of their strengths leading up to the hearing.
